distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
NTP was updated to 4.2.8p12 (bsc#1111853):

- CVE-2018-12327: Fixed stack buffer overflow in the openhost() command-line call of NTPQ/NTPDC. (bsc#1098531)
- CVE-2018-7170: Add further tweaks to improve the fix for the ephemeral association time spoofing additional protection (bsc#1083424)

Please also see https://www.nwtime.org/network-time-foundation-publishes-ntp-4-2-8p12/ for more information.
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: Stack-based buffer overflow in ntpq and ntpdc of NTP version 4.2.8p11 allows an attacker to achieve code execution or escalate to higher privileges via a long string as the argument for an IPv4 or IPv6 command-line parameter. NOTE: It is unclear whether there are any common situations in which ntpq or ntpdc is used with a command line from an untrusted source.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

fixed: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:ntp-4.2.8p12-64.8.2.x86_64
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:ntp-doc-4.2.8p12-64.8.2.x86_64

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:ntp-doc-4.2.8p12-64.8.2.x86_64

notes.text: ntpd in ntp 4.2.x before 4.2.8p7 and 4.3.x before 4.3.92 allows authenticated users that know the private symmetric key to create arbitrarily-many ephemeral associations in order to win the clock selection of ntpd and modify a victim's clock via a Sybil attack. This issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1549.
